and put them into your left forearm.
It's kind of like taking core samples when you're drilling for oil, as an example.
translation.ko: 석유를 시추할 때 견본을 채취하는 작업과 비슷하죠

translation.en: We're going to have to move Mr. Piper to Saint Luke's tomorrow.
translation.ko: 내일 세인트 루크 병원으로 파이퍼 씨를 이송해야 합니다

translation.en: Why do we have to move him?
I believe Don should be able to stay here.
translation.ko: 남편은 여기에 머물러야 할 것 같은데요

translation.en: I agree.
But this is out of my hands.
I've done everything I know to prevent this from happening,
but I can't stop it.
There's a situation at the hospital.
Our insurance no longer covers Don's treatment here.
translation.ko: 보험 회사에서 더는 던의 치료비를 보상할 수 없대요

translation.en: Is there anything you can do?
-I need answers. -Yes, of course you do.
-I'm your Beau. You at the hospital? -Yes.
Meet me in the cafeteria.
I tried but the administrator's right. They're not gonna budge.
translation.ko: 알아봤는데 관리자 말이 맞아요 어쩔 수가 없네요

translation.en: There's nothing you can do to change things?
translation.ko: 이 상황을 바꿀만한 해결책이 없는 건가요?

translation.en: It's about what the hospital can get from the insurance company.
translation.ko: 보험 회사에서 병원에 뭔가를 줘야 하죠

translation.en: What about our case? Our settlement?
Well, I've got good news and I've got bad news,
but the bad news takes out the good news, so all we're left with really is bad news.
translation.ko: 좋은 소식보다 나쁜 소식이 심각해서 나쁜 소식이나 마찬가지예요

translation.en: What?
Well, in Texas, state employees are indemnified by the State of Texas.
translation.ko: 텍사스 주 법률에 따라 공무원은 배상을 받을 권리가 있죠

translation.en: Okay, how does this affect us?
Well, the state, in this case, Texas,
has put a cap on all damages that are able to be collected
translation.ko: 지급해야 하는 모든 손해배상의 한도를 정해 놓죠

translation.en: in any lawsuit against the state,
translation.ko: 텍사스 주를 상대로 한 모든 소송에요

translation.en: and the cap is $250,000.
Now, insurance companies, they have subrogation rights.
Which means that they're gonna put a lien against any kind of claim and settlement
translation.ko: 의료비를 충당하기 위해 소송으로 얻은 자금이나

translation.en: or any funds received from a lawsuit to cover their medical expenses.
translation.ko: 청구와 합의에 유치권을 둘 수 있죠

translation.en: In other words,
your insurance company is gonna take all the money.
translation.ko: 보험 회사에서 모든 돈을 가져갈 수가 있어요

translation.en: Don will receive nothing?
No.
You know, I had a friend one time, he asked me,
translation.ko: 예전에 제 친구가 이런 질문을 했죠

translation.en: he said, "What kind of cookies you bake when you don't have any money?"
translation.ko: '자네가 돈이 없을 때 만들 수 있는 쿠키가 뭔지 알아?'

translation.en: I said, "I don't know, what?" He says, "Shortbread."
translation.ko: 전 모르겠다며 물었고 그 친구는 '작은 쿠키'라고 말했죠

translation.en: Unfortunately, Don's gonna have to bake shortbread cookies on this one.
translation.ko: 안타깝게도 던 씨가 만들 수 있는 건 작은 쿠키뿐이네요

translation.en: He'd have been better off if he'd been hit by a Budweiser truck.
translation.ko: 버드와이저 트럭에 부딪혔으면 차라리 나을 뻔했네요

translation.en: And then we'd all be talking about millions of dollars.
Partner, can I give you a card?
You show up here just to tell me this?
translation.ko: 겨우 그 얘기를 하려고 여기 오신 건가요?

translation.en: How we gonna do this?
We'll take him by ambulance.
You can drive your car.
Even though Saint Luke's was only five blocks away,
translation.ko: "동부 텍사스 구급차" 세인트 루크 병원은 겨우 다섯 블록 거리였지만

translation.en: it was such a painful move with the fixators on my leg and arm.
translation.ko: 팔다리에 고정기를 하고 움직이는 건 정말 고통스러웠다

translation.en: Every bump resonated through my bones.
translation.ko: 차가 덜컹거릴 때마다 뼈에 고통이 전달됐다

translation.en: Eva stayed strong,
trying not to cry out as she watched me go through this.
translation.ko: 이 모든 상황을 지켜보면서도 울지 않으려고 애썼다 "25일째"

translation.en: It's not very pretty here.
It's not ideal. I'm sorry.
I'm so sorry, Don.
When they picked this color blue,
it must have been a cloudy day.
Mr. Piper, Mrs. Piper.
-How you guys doing today? -Hi there.
-Thank you. -Good, good.
I've got some relief for you, Mr. Piper.
I'm gonna take good care of you, okay? Let me just have that arm.
translation.ko: 제가 잘 간호해 드릴게요 팔을 이쪽으로 주세요

translation.en: I'm gonna just hook this up for you,
and this will make you feel a lot better.
All righty.
This is real simple, Mr. Piper.
All you need to do is,
anytime you feel you need some relief,
this will just take it all away for you.
All I need you to do is push this little button here
and it releases medication, all right?
And just call me if you need me.
All right, Mrs. Piper?
-Thank you. -All right, you're welcome.
Mr. and Mrs. Piper, how you doing today?
-We're fine, thank you. -Good.
And how about him?
Hey, Mr. Piper.
So, have you eaten today?
Did you have therapy today?
Did Dr. Greider come by?
Have you had a bowel movement today?
Maybe that's why you're so grumpy.
All right, I'll be back later to check up on you.
translation.ko: 좋아요, 그럼 잠시 후에 확인하러 다시 올게요

translation.en: -Let me know if I can get you anything. -Thank you.
You're welcome.
Why don't you talk?
I can't figure out what's going on inside of you.
translation.ko: 당신이 속으로 무슨 생각을 하는지 모르겠어

translation.en: What happened to you?
Talk to me!
Don, answer me!
I'm sitting right here, please. Why aren't you answering me?
translation.ko: 내가 여기 있잖아 왜 대답을 안 해?

translation.en: Where do you go?
You're not even here anymore.
translation.ko: 그 사람은 이제 여기에 없는 것 같아

translation.en: Is there something you want to tell me?
Where's my husband?
He's not here.
I miss him.
Should I get that for you?
Should I answer that for you?
Hello?
"How's Don?"
He doesn't talk.
He lies here and he doesn't seem to care.
translation.ko: 병실에 누워서 아무 신경도 안 써요

translation.en: Hi, Dad.
Let me call you back. Okay.
What's that?
I know I should have been grateful to be alive.
My downcast attitude was taking its toll on everyone.
translation.ko: 내 우울한 태도 때문에 많은 사람에게 피해를 줬다

translation.en: But I just felt like something was missing and I didn't deserve to be here.
translation.ko: 하지만 뭔가가 결여됐고 내가 살 자격이 없다고 생각했다

translation.en: Hi, Daddy.
Okay, kids, it's time to get on the road. We need to not tire out your father.
translation.ko: 얘들아, 이제 출발해야겠구나 네 아빠도 이제 쉬어야지

translation.en: It's okay, Dad. I'm gonna take them on the first floor to the McDonald's.
Come on. Come on, baby.
Come on.
-Are you okay, Mom? -Yeah.
I never would have dreamed that a cheeseburger and fries would be so good.
I'm in love with French fries.
You're in love with French fries?
Me, too.
Do you think Dad will be home for my birthday?
translation.ko: 제 생일에는 아빠가 집에 오실 수 있을까요?

translation.en: I hope so.
I know he wants to.
Grandpa makes us do our homework before we go to the lake.
translation.ko: 할아버지는 강에 놀러 가기 전에 꼭 숙제를 시키세요

translation.en: As he should.
But he doesn't help us like you do.
Don.
I came to say good night.
You don't want to say good night?
translation.ko: 잘 자라는 인사도 안 해줄 거야?

translation.en: I am tired of this.
You don't seem to care about anything.
You don't care that you're back here with us.
You don't care when the children come and visit you.
translation.ko: 아이들이 문병 오는 거에 관심도 없잖아

translation.en: You don't want to grow old with me,
or see the children get married.
You don't care.
You can take your pain away with that button,
translation.ko: 당신이 느끼는 고통은 그 버튼을 누르면 사라지겠지만

translation.en: but you are causing it to everyone else.
translation.ko: 당신은 다른 사람들에게 고통을 주고 있잖아

translation.en: Welcome to McDonald's. Can I take your order?
Sorry, that's not on the menu.
Lord...
God,
does it really have to be like this?
The pain of the injuries,
I can handle that.
Even seeing the pity and the helplessness
in the eyes of the people who love me and care for me,
I can get through that.
But if this is as good as it's ever gonna get...
I don't want to be a burden.
I was just trying to get back to Alvin and you took me to heaven.
translation.ko: 앨빈 교회로 돌아가고 있었는데 절 천국에 데려가셨잖아요

translation.en: Can't you take me back?
translation.ko: 다시 데려가 주실 수는 없는 건가요?

translation.en: Now.
I want to go back to heaven.
My home.
My home is heaven now.
Jesus, let me come back home, please!
translation.ko: 예수님, 제발 절 다시 데려가 주세요!

translation.en: Please let me come back home.
South Park hired me to be your interim while you're incapacitated,
translation.ko: 사우스 파크에서 자네의 임시직으로 날 고용했네

translation.en: so I guess you could say I'm out of retirement.
translation.ko: 은퇴 생활을 접었다고 자네가 말한 게 아닌가

translation.en: Can I get you a magazine?
Would you like a milkshake?
How about a hamburger?
You lost quite a bit of weight, son.
Would you like for me to read to you from the Bible?
Or any other book, for that matter.
Really, no.
Thanks for coming.
You know, you really need to get your act together.
Sir?
You need to get your act together. You're not doing a very good job right now.
translation.ko: 정신을 차려야지 자넨 지금 못나게 굴잖아

translation.en: I'm not sure I understand.
Besides that, you're a raging hypocrite.
I don't know what you're talking...
You got all these people out there who care so much for you
and you have no idea how much they love you.
-I know they love me. -Really?
Yeah.
You're doing a pretty poor job of letting them know you're aware of that fact.
translation.ko: 자네가 그 사실을 안다는 걸 제대로 알려주지도 않았나 보군

translation.en: I don't think you're treating them right.
translation.ko: 그 사람들을 소중히 대하지 않는 거지

translation.en: Now, they can't heal you,
translation.ko: 그 사람들이 자네를 치료할 수는 없지만

translation.en: but they would heal you if they could.
translation.ko: 만약 할 수 있다면 그들은 최선을 다하겠지

translation.en: And if they could trade places with you, many of them would do that.
translation.ko: 자네를 대신할 수만 있다면 다들 그렇게 할 걸세

translation.en: -Yeah... -And do anything for you
without any waver.
I don't want them to do anything.
translation.ko: 전 그 사람들한테 바라는 게 없어요

translation.en: Truth is, I don't even want them to be here. I'd just as soon they not come.
translation.ko: 차라리 혼자 있고 싶고 아무도 안 왔으면 좋겠어요

translation.en: I know it's inconvenient. They must have better things to do.
translation.ko: 여기 오는 게 얼마나 불편한지 아니까 그 시간에 다른 걸 했으면 해요

translation.en: I know that!
Why would I want anyone to come see me like this?
translation.ko: 이런 상태에서 제가 누굴 만나고 싶겠어요?

translation.en: It's awful!
It's not your call.
It's not about you.
You spent the better part of your life trying to minister to other people,
translation.ko: 자넨 다른 사람들을 보살피며 인생을 훌륭하게 살아왔네

translation.en: trying to be there for their needs,
and to be there for them through difficulty and tragedy.
I've tried to.
And yet you have deprived them of doing the same thing for you.
translation.ko: 하지만 그 사람들이 자네에게 베풀 기회를 빼앗아 버렸지

translation.en: And that's all they have to offer you, Don.
translation.ko: 그들이 자네에게 베풀 기회를 줘야지, 던

translation.en: You're taking that gift away from them. I appreciate them.
translation.ko: - 그들의 선물을 뺏은 거야 - 전 고마워하고 있어요

translation.en: I do. I know they want to help and I think that's very fine and all, but...
translation.ko: 저를 돕고 싶은 것도 알고 그게 좋고 행복하지만

translation.en: But nothing!
Now, I want you to let them in, you hear me?
translation.ko: 이제 그 사람들을 받아들이게 내 말 듣고 있나?

translation.en: You're going to let them in
and let them help you.
I can't.
Well, if you don't feel like you can for yourself,
what about doing it for me?
translation.ko: 날 위해서 그래 줄 수는 없겠나?

translation.en: What about next time somebody walks through that door
and wants to do something for you, I don't care what it is,
translation.ko: 자네에게 도움을 주려고 하면 그게 뭐든지 간에

translation.en: say yes.
Let a few folks
express their love by doing something for you.
I mean, promise me that you'll do that.
Just...
Look,
try it for me.
You're gonna need to get better at this.
Now, this is one of the lessons that God wants you to learn.
translation.ko: 주님도 자네가 그걸 배우길 바라고 계셔

translation.en: All right, I promise.
People are God's hands to meet your needs
translation.ko: 우린 하나님의 손에 달려있네 자네의 요청을 듣고

translation.en: and answer your prayers.
We'll just keep looking till it feels right.
translation.ko: 괜찮은 집을 발견할 때까지 계속 찾아보자

translation.en: What kind of house are we looking for?
Well,
probably something one story, manageable to get around in for Dad.
Is Dad gonna be in a wheelchair?
Yeah. For a little while.
As the medical bills were mounting, Eva looked for a house that we could afford,
translation.ko: 내 의료비가 엄청났기 때문에 아내는 퇴원 후에 살 집으로

translation.en: that would accommodate my needs once I was discharged from Saint Luke's.
translation.ko: 가계 형편에 맞으면서도 내게 편한 집을 찾았다

translation.en: Hey, hey, hey, there he is.
Got something for you.
Look, let me do it. Looks like you need my help.
translation.ko: 제가 해드릴게요 제 도움이 필요한 것 같네요

translation.en: How are you today?
Not speaking to me again?
translation.ko: 또 저한테 말 안 하실 건가요?

translation.en: Okay. It's a letter.
It says, "Hi there, we share wrenches.
"Fortunately for both of us, our fixators are interchangeable,
"and we can borrow tools from one another."
That's so cute. Look at that. It's a happy face.
translation.ko: 귀엽네요, 여기 보세요 웃는 얼굴도 있어요

translation.en: -Who is this? -This is from Christy.
Christy is a teenage girl that lives in the next room.
translation.ko: 크리스티는 옆 방에 입원한 십 대 소녀예요

translation.en: She was born with one leg shorter than the other,
so she had to have surgery to attach the Ilizarov frame, like yours,
translation.ko: 파이퍼 씨처럼 일리자로프 장치를 부착하는 수술을 했어요

translation.en: so that both legs would be of normal size.
translation.ko: 지금은 두 다리 모두 정상 길이가 됐죠

translation.en: She has a fixator, too?
She goes on.
"And we share something else, too. Pain."
She says, "I hear you scream at night sometimes, as you probably hear me, too.
translation.ko: '가끔 밤에 아저씨 비명이 들리는데 아마 제 비명도 들으셨을 거예요'

translation.en: "Although our nurse says that you don't admit to it."
translation.ko: '우리 간호사가 말하길 아저씨는 그걸 부인한다고 하던데요'

translation.en: Don't... Don't... Don't shoot me now.
I'm just the messenger, Mr. Piper.
And she goes on and says,
"You're not alone. Sincerely, Christy."
That is so sweet.
Can you get me a pen and paper, please?
I can if you acknowledge me.
There you go.
I like that.
All right. I'll be right back.
That's my boy.
"Dear Christy,
"in some of my worst moments of self-pity, I think of never being normal again.
translation.ko: '난 끔찍한 자기 연민 때문에 평범한 삶은 꿈도 꾸지 못했지'

translation.en: "I believe that when all of the pain is over, "Christy, you will be a normal young woman.
translation.ko: '모든 고통이 끝나면 넌 평범한 여성이 될 거야'

translation.en: "You will play and run and do everything a normal teen can do.
translation.ko: '마음껏 놀고 뛰어다니며 평범한 십 대처럼 다 할 수 있겠지'

translation.en: "You're doing something that positively impacts the rest of your life.
translation.ko: '네 삶에 긍정적인 영향을 주는 일을 할 수 있을 거야'

translation.en: "Keep the faith.
"Kindest, Don.
"P.S.
"If God brings you to it, he will bring you through it."
translation.ko: '주님께서 네게 고난을 준다면 이겨낼 힘도 같이 주실 거란다'

translation.en: It's not long before you go home. This is your first step in that direction.
translation.ko: 퇴원이 다가오네요 이 훈련이 그 첫 단계예요

translation.en: My first step is wanting to vomit.
Yeah, nausea will get you every time.
Your equilibrium has changed.
You've grown used to being in a horizontal position.
translation.ko: 수평 자세가 익숙한 상태에서 좀 자랐거든요

translation.en: I'd like my tools back.
Hi, I'm Christy, your long-lost pen pal.
translation.ko: 안녕하세요, 전 크리스티예요 아저씨의 오랜 펜팔 친구죠

translation.en: Or Hopalong Cassidy, as my friends say.
Hi.
I'm Don.
-How are you? -Could be worse.
How's that?
Okay, you got me. It can't get much worse.
translation.ko: 모르겠어요, 이보다 더 끔찍한 건 없을 거예요

translation.en: The endless reruns of The Brady Bunch at 3:00 a.m.
translation.ko: 새벽 세 시에 '브래디 번치' 계속 재방송하더라

translation.en: Yeah, well,
I wish my only problem was getting hit in the face with a football like Marcia.
translation.ko: 마샤처럼 얼굴에 공을 맞아도 좋으니까 축구하고 싶네요

translation.en: I'd take a broken nose to dance normal.
translation.ko: 아니면 코뼈가 부러져도 좋으니 춤이라도 췄으면 하죠

translation.en: You'll dance.
Only the truest friends show up when you have to move.
translation.ko: 이사할 때 오는 친구가 진정한 친구라던데

translation.en: Trust me, this is a vacation.
-Vacation? -Yes, from my children.
Well, thank you.
Remember when Don's parents gave us this painting?
translation.ko: 시부모님이 이 그림 주신 거 기억나?

translation.en: Yes, I remember.
I remember you tried to pawn it off on me and then Susan and...
translation.ko: 네가 나한테 그걸 떠넘기려고 했고 수잔한테 시도하다가

translation.en: And the Goodwill store.
That's not true!
-That is true. -And never told Don.
Is all this stuff going to fit in the new house?
translation.ko: 이 물건을 새집에 다 가져갈 수 있어?

translation.en: I think so. This place just isn't gonna work for Don.
You know, with all the stairs and him being in a wheelchair.
translation.ko: 던은 휠체어를 타야 하는데 여긴 계단이 있잖아

translation.en: Plus, the new home is closer to the church.
That will be nice.
Just came by to check on you. See how you were doing.
You're looking good.
I hear you're gonna be going home before long.
Anything I can do for you before I go?
translation.ko: 가기 전에 내가 해줄 게 있을까?

translation.en: That's a very fine offer.
I wish I had a magazine to read.
You do? Really?
I think so.
I haven't read one in a while.
Well, all right. Give me just a minute.
Jay B. Perkins, a retired minister, was a powerful father figure to me.
translation.ko: 은퇴 목사인 제이 B 퍼킨스 목사님은 내겐 든든한 아버지 같은 존재였다

translation.en: And I was grateful for his service to my church while I was incapacitated.
translation.ko: 입원해 있는 동안 퍼킨스 목사님이 내 교회를 돌봐준 게 감사했다

translation.en: This ought to do you.
There you go.
-Thank you much. I'll... -That'll keep you busy.
-I'll read them a bit later. -Yeah.
Anything else I can do?
No, that's... That's all I need. Thank you.
When you open the door and let somebody do something nice for you,
translation.ko: 이 병실을 방문하는 사람에게 자네를 돕게 하는 게

translation.en: turns out not to be so hard after all.
You were right, Jay B.
I thought that
relieving people of the responsibility of having to care for me
translation.ko: 누군가에게 저를 돌봐야 한다는 책임감을 덜어주는 게

translation.en: was the right thing to do.
It wasn't.
They would heal me if they could,
translation.ko: 그 사람들은 할 수만 있다면 저를 치료했을 거예요

translation.en: and since they can't do that, they were caring for me
translation.ko: 그럴 수 없었기 때문에 저를 돌봐준 거죠

translation.en: in the only way that they can.
translation.ko: 그게 그들이 할 수 있는 최선이었으니까요

translation.en: I have denied them
the blessing of caring.
You've loved me enough to tell me the truth.
translation.ko: 목사님은 진실을 말씀하실 정도로 절 사랑하셨던 거죠

translation.en: I won't forget it.
And I never have.
After 34 surgeries
and nearly four months in the hospital,
Dr. Greider said I could go home.
Bye, thank you.
Dr. Greider.
Hold up a second.
Tell me something.
Just how bad was I when they brought me in the night of the accident?
translation.ko: 사고로 실려 온 날에 제 상태가 얼마나 심각했나요?

translation.en: I've seen worse,
but they didn't live.
Thank you, sir.
He would become a friend of mine from that day forward.
translation.ko: 그날 이후 그라이더 박사님과 난 친구가 됐다

translation.en: -Bye, Christy. -Bye.
I want you to call me when you get out of here.
Will do.
Hi, Daddy!
Hey, Dad!
How do you like the new house?
What do you think?
Welcome home, Daddy, welcome home.
I think I'm home.
There's the kitchen.
Did you put milk in it? I'm just gonna do this.
I know.
Is it good?
Smells good in there.
Why don't you... We're gonna play a game. Okay, you ready?
translation.ko: 우린 게임을 할 거야 좋아, 준비됐지?

translation.en: Eva organized something called the Don Patrol.
A group of church members and friends who took care of me
so that she could teach and we could keep our insurance.
translation.ko: 아내가 일을 나간 덕분에 보험을 계속 유지할 수 있었다

translation.en: The Don Patrol would arrive around 9:00 while I was still sleeping.
translation.ko: 내가 자고 있으면 오전 9시에 던 순찰대가 온다

translation.en: Good morning.
I might awake to see one of the Susans knitting on the couch at the end of my bed.
translation.ko: 내 침대 밑 소파에서 수잔은 뜨개질했고

translation.en: Or someone would be there with a toothbrush so I could brush my teeth.
translation.ko: 어떤 사람은 칫솔을 가져와서 양치하는 걸 도와주었다

translation.en: Looking good.
Often times holding a glass of juice before I was done doing that.
translation.ko: 양치가 끝나기도 전에 주스를 갖다 주기도 했다

translation.en: Maybe even offering an electric shaver.
All right, I've never actually used one of these before.
It's pretty simple.
You know what, it doesn't actually work.
And a big lunch.
Turkey sandwich, oatmeal cookie, pickles.
You can't pass up baby pickles.
-I'll take the apple. -Okay.
Another friend might be reading the newspaper,
ready to entertain me.
Yeah, whatever you need. I'll even sing for you if you want.
translation.ko: 원하는 건 뭐든지요 노래도 부를 수 있죠

translation.en: Some guests would even make themselves quite comfortable.
Hey, Butterfly.
Come here.
Butterfly, no!
translation.ko: 나비야, 안 돼! 나비야, 안 돼!

translation.en: Hey!
Hi, honey.
Everything okay?
-You sure? -Yeah.
It smells like pee in here.
translation.ko: 집 안에 소변 냄새가 나는 것 같아

translation.en: I know. It was the dog.
It's okay if you can't make it to the bathroom.
translation.ko: 당신은 화장실 가는 게 불편하니까 이해해

translation.en: It was the dog.
Butterfly?
Hey, Dad.
Come on.
You can do it.
I did it.
I did it.
I walked!
I walked.
Oh, Lord, I walked.
What's going on? What's happening?
-Ma'am. -Where's Don?
-Ma'am. -Where's my husband?
Ma'am. I'd like for you to consider this as a private matter.
translation.ko: 부인, 이건 지극히 개인적인 문제 같은데요

translation.en: -Private? -Private.
-This is my house. -Hey.
I've seen it all.
Bet you haven't seen this yet.
translation.ko: 이런 건 처음 보실 것 같은데요

translation.en: What's going on?
I got my fixator stuck to the toilet seat.
Happy birthday.
This is a perfect day.
God has given me children so much better than I deserve.
How can I ever thank you for all they mean to me?
translation.ko: 이 은혜를 당신한테 어떻게 표현해야 할까?

translation.en: You being alive is the gift.
Dad, will you dance with me?
Sweetie, I'd like to, but...
Please, Dad.
-I don't think I can. -Please?
I need you to help me up here.
David!
What are you doing here?
I'm in town for a discipleship weekend.
It's the excuse I use to come into the house and spend time with you.
translation.ko: 그 핑계로 이렇게 자네도 보는 거지

translation.en: Thank you for your friendship,
and your relentless commitment to prayer.
Of course, Don. How you feeling now?
translation.ko: 친구끼리 당연하지, 던 요즘은 좀 어때?

translation.en: In pain.
But I'm always in pain.
That's not the worst part of it for me right now.
There are things I can't physically do anymore.
translation.ko: 내가 물리적으로 할 수 없는 일들이 있어

translation.en: I'm not sure that God wants me to continue at South Park.
translation.ko: 하나님께서 내가 사우스 파크에 계속 있길 원하시는지 모르겠어

translation.en: I feel loved and needed there,
but I'm not sure it's where I should be.
What did you learn from your accident and your recovery experience?
translation.ko: 사고를 경험하고 회복하는 과정에서 네가 깨달은 게 뭐야?

translation.en: Letting other people inside.
Allowing others to help me.
But in the midst of all the suffering and despondency,
translation.ko: 이 모든 고통과 낙담을 경험하는 가운에

translation.en: David,
I've learned that heaven is real.
What do you mean by that?
I died that day.
The next moment, I stood in heaven.
Why haven't you mentioned this before?
translation.ko: 왜 전에 이런 얘기를 안 한 거야?

translation.en: I have two very good reasons for that.
Number one, I go around talking about having been to heaven,
translation.ko: 첫째로, 내가 천국에 가봤다고 얘기하고 다니면

translation.en: people will think I'm nuts.
Why would you think that?
-You just told me. -Number two...
-I don't think you're nuts. -Number two.
translation.ko: - 난 미쳤다고 생각 안 해 - 둘째로

translation.en: I don't want to go over that experience again.
translation.ko: 그 경험을 다시 끄집어내고 싶지 않았어

translation.en: It's too personal, too special.
It's my sacred secret.
Is it possible that God took you to heaven,
brought you back,
so that you could share your experience with others?
translation.ko: 그 경험을 다른 사람들과 공유하란 뜻 아닐까?

translation.en: Don't you realize what a powerful encouragement you could be?
translation.ko: 네가 얼마나 강력한 격려를 줄 수 있는지 모르겠어?

translation.en: I want you to make a covenant with me.
-What kind of a covenant? -It's simple.
Find someone you trust.
Share a little bit about your story, just to gauge their response.
translation.ko: 네 얘기를 조금만 공유하고 그들의 반응을 보는 거야

translation.en: If they think you're crazy or you hallucinated,
translation.ko: 만약 누군가 네가 미쳤거나 환영을 본 거라고 생각하면

translation.en: I promise... I promise, you never have to talk about it again.
translation.ko: 내가 약속하는데 더는 이 얘기를 안 해도 돼

translation.en: But if they rejoice with you and urge you to tell them more,
translation.ko: 하지만 그들이 같이 기뻐하고 그 얘기를 더 듣고 싶어 한다면

translation.en: I want you to take it as a sign.
A sign that God wants you to talk about those 90 minutes you spent in heaven.
translation.ko: 천국에서 보낸 90분의 이야기를 널리 알리라는 하나님의 신호지

translation.en: I think I can do that much.
When?
Soon.
I promise.
Very soon, right?
All right, very soon.
-Hi, honey. -Hi, darling.
Hey, David. Glad you could make it.
Soon as in now.
-Honey? -Yes.
Darling, I want to tell you something.
What's that?
Remember the day I left for the convention?
translation.ko: 내가 교회 콘퍼런스에 참석했던 날 기억나?

translation.en: Well, that morning just plays over and over in my head.
translation.ko: 내 머릿속에서 자꾸 그 날 아침이 맴돌아

translation.en: And you said, "IOU."
Yes. And I do.
Well, in fact, I think I owe you.
translation.ko: 내 생각에는 내가 당신한테 빚진 것 같아

translation.en: Don't I know it. I've been waiting a long time for that.
translation.ko: 이미 알고 있어 그래서 지금까지 기다렸지

translation.en: I owe you an explanation.
Darling, would you sit down for a second?
Please.
You know, I died in that accident.
When I woke up,
I was in heaven.
You went to heaven?
Yes.
Tell me more.
When I died,
I didn't flow through a long dark tunnel.
I had no sense of fading away or coming back.
I heard no voices calling to me or anything like that.
translation.ko: 날 부르는 목소리나 그런 것도 전혀 못 들었지

translation.en: Simultaneous with my last recollection of seeing the bridge,
the rain,
a light enveloped me
translation.ko: 그와 동시에 어떤 빛이 나를 감쌌어

translation.en: with a brilliance beyond earthly comprehension or description.
translation.ko: 현실에서 이해하거나 말로 표현할 수 없을 정도로 빛났지

translation.en: In my next moment of awareness, I was standing in heaven.
translation.ko: 그리고 의식을 차렸을 때 나는 천국에 서 있었어

translation.en: It was perfect.
And I knew right then I would have no need sand never would again.
translation.ko: 어떤 욕구도 없었고 다시 생기지 않을 것도 알았지

translation.en: I didn't even think of Earth or of those left behind.
translation.ko: 이 세상이나 여기에 두고 온 것들이 전혀 생각나지 않았어

translation.en: Though I did not see Jesus face-to-face,
I did sense his presence at every turn.
translation.ko: 사방에서 그분의 존재를 느낄 수가 있었어

translation.en: And I did see people I had known.
As they surged towards me,
I knew instantly that all of them had died during my lifetime.
translation.ko: 난 그들이 내 생전에 이미 죽은 사람들이란 걸 알았고

translation.en: Their presence seemed absolutely natural.
translation.ko: 그들이 그곳에 있다는 게 지극히 자연스럽게 느껴졌지

translation.en: It was as if God had removed anything negative or worrisome
translation.ko: 마치 주님께서 내 의식 속에 있는 부정적이고 걱정스러운 생각을

translation.en: from my consciousness,
and I could only rejoice at being together with these wonderful people.
translation.ko: 그렇게 아름다운 사람들과 함께 있는 게 기뻤어

translation.en: Donnie, I'm so excited you're here to join us.
translation.ko: 던, 우리와 같이 있게 돼서 정말 좋구나

translation.en: I saw Papa.
You know, my grandfather that everyone called Joe.
I heard his voice and felt his embrace.
translation.ko: 할아버지의 목소리를 들었고 날 껴안아 주는 것도 느꼈어

translation.en: I'd been with him when he'd suffered a heart attack at home
and had ridden with him in the ambulance.
translation.ko: 구급차로 실려 가실 때 나도 같이 있었어

translation.en: I'd been standing just outside the emergency room at the hospital
when the doctor walked out and faced me.
The doctor shook his head and said softly, "We did everything we could."
translation.ko: 의사는 고개를 저으면서 최선을 다했다고 부드럽게 말했어

translation.en: As I walked among them, I became aware of the wide variety of ages.
translation.ko: 그 사람들 사이로 걸어가면서 나이가 서로 다르다는 걸 알았지

translation.en: Old and young and every age in between.
translation.ko: 노인과 청년뿐 아니라 모든 연령대가 존재했어

translation.en: Many of them hadn't known each other on Earth,
but each had influenced my life in some way.
translation.ko: 다들 어떤 식으로든 내게 영향을 준 사람들이지

translation.en: Even though they hadn't met on Earth,
translation.ko: 심지어 현실에서 만난 적이 없다고 하더라도 말이야

translation.en: they seemed to know each other now.
translation.ko: 그들은 서로를 잘 아는 것처럼 보였어

translation.en: One person in the greeting committee was Mike Wood, my childhood friend.
translation.ko: 인사하는 사람 중에 어릴 적 친구인 마이크 우드가 있었어

translation.en: He was a popular kid and became a hero to me
translation.ko: 마이크는 인기 많은 아이였고 내 우상이었지

translation.en: because he lived the Christian lifestyle and often talked about it.
translation.ko: 그는 그리스도인의 삶에 대해 자주 얘기했고 또 그렇게 살았거든

translation.en: After high school, Mike received a full scholarship to Louisiana State University.
translation.ko: 졸업 후 그는 루이지애나 주립대에서 전액 장학금을 받았어

translation.en: When he was 19, Mike was killed in a car wreck.
When I attended his funeral, I wondered if I would ever stop crying.
translation.ko: 마이크의 장례식에서 난 울음을 멈출 수가 없었어

translation.en: I couldn't understand why God had taken such a dedicated disciple.
translation.ko: 왜 주님께서 그렇게 헌신적인 제자를 데려갔는지 이해할 수 없었지

translation.en: Through the years since then,
I had never been able to forget that pain and sense of loss.
translation.ko: 그 고통과 상실감을 쉽게 잊지 못했지

translation.en: Then I saw Barry Wilson, who had been a classmate in high school,
translation.ko: 그리고 고등학교 친구인 배리 윌슨도 봤는데

translation.en: but later drowned in a lake.
Barry's smile radiated a happiness I didn't know was possible.
translation.ko: 배리의 미소가 너무 행복해 보였는데 어떻게 그럴 수 있는지 몰랐어

translation.en: And I saw my great-grandmother, Hattie Mann.
As a child, I knew her only after she had developed osteoporosis.
translation.ko: 난 할머니가 골다공증에 걸리신 이후만 봤기 때문에

translation.en: Her head and her shoulders were always bent forward,
translation.ko: 할머니의 머리와 어깨가 늘 굽어 있어서

translation.en: giving her a sort of humped appearance.
But the beautiful thing is she didn't carry these burdens in heaven.
translation.ko: 천국에서 할머니가 그 짐을 덜어낸 모습이 정말 아름다웠어

translation.en: Heaven was many things,
translation.ko: 천국에 대해 다양하게 표현할 수 있겠지만

translation.en: but without a doubt it was the greatest family reunion of all.
translation.ko: 최고의 가족 모임이란 건 의심할 여지가 없었어

translation.en: A holy awe came over me as I stepped forward.
translation.ko: 앞으로 나아갈 때마다 신성한 경외심이 들었어

translation.en: I had no idea what lay ahead,
translation.ko: 내 앞에 뭐가 있는지 알 수 없었지만

translation.en: but I sensed that with each step I took, it would grow more wondrous.
translation.ko: 걸음을 뗄 때마다 경이로움이 커지는 걸 느꼈어

translation.en: And I heard the music.
I can only describe it as a holy swoosh of wings,
but I'd have to magnify that thousands of times
to explain the effect of the sound in heaven.
It was the most beautiful and pleasant sound I'd ever heard.
translation.ko: 내가 들은 소리 중에 가장 아름답고 즐거웠지

translation.en: I saw a bright iridescence.
I peered through the gate yearning to see what lay beyond.
translation.ko: 그 너머에 뭐가 있는지 갈망하며 문틈을 들여다봤지

translation.en: It wasn't an anxious yearning,
but a peaceful openness to experience all of the grace and joy of heaven.
translation.ko: 천국의 모든 영광과 환희를 즐기는 평화로운 자유였어

translation.en: At that very moment, I was about to realize the yearning of every human heart.
translation.ko: 바로 그 순간에 모든 이들의 갈망하는 마음을 느낄 수 있었지

translation.en: I was in heaven, ready to go through the pearlescent gates.
translation.ko: 난 천국에 있었고 진줏빛의 문을 막 통과하려고 했어

translation.en: Then, just as suddenly as I'd arrived at the gates of heaven,
I left there.
I spent a lot of time in the hospital trying to make sense of all of this.
translation.ko: 난 이 모든 걸 이해하려고 병원에서 많은 시간을 보냈어

translation.en: I was paralyzed by the notion of not wanting to return.
translation.ko: 여기로 돌아오고 싶지 않다는 생각에 무력해져 있었지

translation.en: I mean, why come back to this much pain?
I think now I know.
I do, too.
I believe it's time for me to go back to church.
translation.ko: 이제 교회로 돌아갈 때인 것 같아

translation.en: I believe that, too.
Have you told anyone else about this?
translation.ko: 이 얘기를 다른 사람한테 한 적 있어?

translation.en: Yes.
David.
Are you hurt that I didn't tell you first?
translation.ko: 당신한테 제일 먼저 얘기하지 않아서 상처받았어?

translation.en: No.
I feel elated to know.
Because it enables me to understand the man to whom I'm married.
translation.ko: 덕분에 내가 결혼한 남자를 이해할 수 있게 됐거든

translation.en: Eva.
Yes.
Eva,
no one should have to do the things that you had to do for me.
translation.ko: 당신이 날 위해 한 일은 누구도 겪지 말아야 할 일이었어

translation.en: But you did them,
faithfully, compassionately and without hesitation.
You come closest
to really knowing how painful this journey has been for me.
Each day,
you endured it with me.
Eva,
you are my gift from God.
I was so enthusiastic about finally returning to South Park.
translation.ko: 마침내 난 사우스 파크로 돌아와서 기뻤다

translation.en: I hadn't been out of bed for more than an hour at a time,
translation.ko: 사고 이래 한 시간 이상 움직여본 적이 없는데

translation.en: and, well, I overestimated my endurance and suddenly felt incredibly fatigued.
translation.ko: 내 체력을 과대평가한 탓에 급격히 피로감을 느꼈다

translation.en: Yet, the overwhelming response from the congregation gave me
a new burst of strength,
and I knew right then that their praise was for God's work and my healing.
translation.ko: 그때 난 하나님이 하신 일과 내 회복에 대한 그들의 찬양을 느꼈다

translation.en: It's only taken me
five months
to get from the conference at Trinity Pines back to church.
translation.ko: 트리니티 파인스 콘퍼런스에서 교회로 돌아오는 데 말이야

translation.en: I may be slow, but I'm faithful.
They would like for you to say something to the congregation.
Eva, I think I made a mistake. I don't think I can do this.
translation.ko: 에바, 내가 실수했어 난 못 할 것 같아

translation.en: -You can. -I'm not sure if I'm ready.
translation.ko: - 할 수 있어 - 아직 준비가 안 됐어

translation.en: You are.
Let's hear it, Don.
Say something, Don, please.
You prayed.
I'm here.
Here he is.
Hey, Don! Don!
Hey!
-You made it. -Yeah.
It's so good to see you.
I believe that I'm alive today because you prayed me back to Earth.
translation.ko: 목사님이 절 살리려고 기도해주셔서 이렇게 살아난 것 같아요

translation.en: Tell you what, you buy me lunch, we'll call it even.
translation.ko: 밥이라도 사면서 얘기해요 그걸로 빚을 청산하죠

translation.en: -All right, it's a deal. -That's right.
I couldn't figure out how to get inside, so I just pried open the trunk,
translation.ko: 전 차 안으로 들어갈 수가 없어서 트렁크를 비집어 열고

translation.en: knocked down the back seat and crawled in that way.
translation.ko: 뒷좌석을 당겨 젖혀 안으로 기어서 들어갔죠

translation.en: But even when I was praying with you, I didn't know it was you.
translation.ko: 하지만 기도하면서도 그 사람이 당신인지 몰랐어요

translation.en: Besides, no one lives through that.
translation.ko: 게다가 그런 사고를 겪고 살아나긴 어렵죠

translation.en: Well, in my first moments of consciousness,
two things stand out.
First,
I was singing.
-I don't sing. -No.
What a Friend We Have in Jesus.
And the second was that Dick had climbed into the car with me
translation.ko: 두 번째로 느낀 건 딕이 차를 기어 올라와서

translation.en: and his hand had gripped mine and held it tight.
translation.ko: 제 손을 아주 꽉 잡고 있었다는 거예요

translation.en: But the one thing that is absolutely clear
was Dick being in the car and praying with me.
translation.ko: 딕이 차 안에서 저와 함께 기도했다는 거죠

translation.en: That's true. He did get in the car and prayed with you.
translation.ko: 맞아요, 딕이 차 안에 들어가서 같이 기도했어요

translation.en: But, Don, he never held your hand.
Nope.
I remember it so clearly, though. It was one of the most vivid details.
translation.ko: 제가 분명히 기억해요 정말로 생생한 순간이었다고요

translation.en: It didn't happen. It was physically impossible.
There's just no physical way possible I could have reached your right hand.
translation.ko: 그 상황에서 당신의 오른손을 잡는 건 물리적으로 불가능했죠

translation.en: But...
But I swear, I...
Someone was holding your hand,
but it wasn't Dick.
Dick Onerecker was a real prayer warrior before and after the accident.
translation.ko: 사고 전이나 후나 딕 목사님은 신실한 기도의 용사였다

translation.en: He would pass away only a few years after praying for me on that bridge.
translation.ko: 딕 목사님은 다리에서 날 위해 기도하고 몇 년 뒤에 세상을 떠나셨다

translation.en: Okay, you guys, right in here.
-Hey, darling. Darling. -Yeah?
-I'll be right back. -Okay.
Boy, that really hurts, doesn't it?
Yeah, it hurts very much.
Yeah, I know.
Believe me, I know.
You do?
Yeah. I had one, too.
It's horrible.
It's just horrible.
It's awful, I know that.
I wore one on my left leg for 11 months.
translation.ko: 난 왼발에 고정기를 11개월 동안 하고 다녔어

translation.en: -Nobody ever understands. -Well, they can't.
translation.ko: - 아무도 이해 못 하던데요 - 이해 못 하지

translation.en: It's not something you can talk about and have anyone understand your pain.
translation.ko: 네가 얘기한다고 해도 그 고통을 이해하지 못할 거야

translation.en: -I'm Don. -I'm Mark.
Well, Mark,
you just met someone who does understand the pain
translation.ko: 넌 방금 네가 겪고 있는 고통과 낙담을

translation.en: and the discouragement you're going through.
I don't know if I'm gonna make it.
You'll make it.
You're gonna make it. Hey.
Hey, trust me. You'll make it.
translation.ko: 날 믿으렴 넌 할 수 있어

translation.en: -What happened? -I had a skiing accident.
You're a football player?
Yes, sir.
I'm gonna tell you something.
One day, you will walk again.
translation.ko: 언젠가 넌 다시 걸을 수 있을 거야

translation.en: You might not be playing football, but you'll walk.
translation.ko: 축구는 못 해도 걸을 수는 있을 거란다

translation.en: Here's my card. Number's right there.
translation.ko: 여기 내 명함이야 밑에 전화번호가 있어

translation.en: You can call me anytime day or night, 24 hours a day. All right?
Now, I'm gonna walk back over there to my family.
I want you to watch me,
and as you watch, I want you to know that one day you will walk, too.
translation.ko: 네가 본 것처럼 언젠가 너도 걸을 수 있을 거야

translation.en: You'll probably do it better than I do.
You met someone who understands. Give me a call, all right?
translation.ko: 널 이해하는 사람을 만난 거야 내게 전화하렴, 알겠지?

translation.en: Thank you. Thank you. Thank you so much.
Hey, it's not about me.
Before I died on that bridge, I was unsure of what my purpose was.
translation.ko: 그날 다리에서 죽기 전까지 난 내 목적이 무엇인지 몰랐다

translation.en: Now I see it more clearly.
Ministering and sharing the hope I found.
translation.ko: 사람들을 보살피고 내가 찾은 희망을 공유하는 것이다

translation.en: Over 25 years ago,
that big truck took my life on that old bridge.
translation.ko: 그 낡은 다리에서 거대한 트럭이 제 생명을 앗아갔죠

translation.en: I am not the man I used to be.
translation.ko: "던 파이퍼 목사 2015년 3월 5일 애틀랜타" 전 예전의 제가 아닙니다

translation.en: I have been beaten up,
but I'm not beaten.
I have chosen to be not bitter,
but better.
And it is a choice.
Every day of my life, I still ask the same question
translation.ko: 저는 아직도 매일 같은 질문을 합니다

translation.en: that I asked in that bed, that hospital bed, every day.
"Oh, Lord, why?
"Why did you let me see heaven and take it away from me?"
translation.ko: '왜 제게 천국을 보여주고 다시 빼앗아 가셨나요?'

translation.en: I believe it is so that I could be here with you today
and tell you to your face,
God still answers prayer.
God is still in the miracle business today.
God is able to help us find a new normal,
and overcome tragedy and loss, pain and suffering.
translation.ko: 비극과 상실, 고통과 고난을 이겨내길 도와주시죠

translation.en: And God is building us a better place.
translation.ko: 하나님은 우리를 위해 더 나은 미래를 예비하고 계십니다

translation.en: Heaven is real.
I may not meet you here,
translation.ko: 우리는 여기서 만나지 않을 수도 있어요

translation.en: this side of heaven.
So my prayer for you today is, if I don't meet you here,
translation.ko: 오늘 제 기도는 이거예요 우리가 이곳에서 만나지 않는다면

translation.en: one day I want to see you there
translation.ko: 언젠가 저 위에서 다시 보길 바랍니다

translation.en: at the gates.
And may God help us to be found faithful until that day.
translation.ko: 그때까지 신실한 성도가 되도록 주님께서 도와주시길 기도합니다
